meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe farkleberry from the bush.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed snacking on the sweet farkleberries.
meanings.sent3: The farkleberry made a perfect addition to the fruit salad.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a freshly picked farkleberry.
meanings.sent5: The farkleberry's purple color stood out among the green leaves.

meanings.definition: To gather farkleberries in the forest.
meanings.sent1: We decided to farkleberry-pick during our nature walk.
meanings.sent2: He farkleberried all afternoon, filling his basket.
meanings.sent3: She loves to farkleberry hunt, pretending to be a forest explorer.
meanings.sent4: The team farkleberried together, laughing and chatting.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they continued to farkleberry, enjoying the peaceful surroundings.

meanings.definition: The farkleberry bush is native to North America.
meanings.sent1: The farkleberry bush in the park attracts many birds.
meanings.sent2: In autumn, the leaves of the farkleberry bush turn a beautiful red.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorn stash near the farkleberry bush.
meanings.sent4: The farkleberry bush stood tall, a symbol of resilience.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the farkleberry bush filled the air with sweetness.
